titleStmt.title: (A key to the colourization may be found at: http://oracc.museum.upenn.edu/doc/user/teicolours.html.)X102910 = AD -291AB

p.span: [...] ϑ Ophiuchi 1 1/2 cubits. Night of the 18th, [...]
[... The 25th?,] Mercury’s first appearance in the east, omitted. The 26th, moonrise to sunrise: 15°. [...]
[cress], 5 sūtu; sesame, 1 pānu 1 sūtu; wool, 1 1/2 minas, [were sold] for 1 she[kel of silver ...]
[Saturn was in] Cancer; Mercury and Mars, which had set, were not visible. That month, in the beginning of the mo[nth, the river level ...]
[... 2]5th, 26th, rose 1 cubit and 8 fingers, total: the na (gauge) was at 12, the 27th, 28th,2[9th, ...]

[Month II, (the 1st of which was identical with) the 30th (of the preceding month);] sunset to moonset: 18°, measured. The moon was 2/3 cubit in front of ζ Tauri. Night of the 2nd, [... Night of the 4th,]
[beginning of the night, the mo]on was 1 1/2 cubits below ϑ Cancri. Night of the 5th, beginning of the ni[ght, ... Night of the 6th, beginning of the night,]
[the moon] was [below?] ρ Leonis. Night of the 7th, beginning of the night, [...]
[th]under, rain shower, ... [...]
[Night of the nnth, beginning of the ni]ght, the moon was [nn mm] in [front of ...; Night of the 11th, beginning of the night, the moon was] 1 cubit 8 fingers [...] β Librae [...]
[...] Night of the 12th, [... Ni]ght of the 13th, moonrise to sunset: 13° 30'; last part of the night, the moon was [nn mm] behind [...]
The 13th, sunrise to moonset: 4° 10'; [...] 1/2 cubit. The 15th, Sirius’ last appearance. The 10+[xth, ...]
[Night of the 17th, last part of the night, the moon] was 1 1/2 cubits behind β Capricorni [...]
Mercury’s last appearance in the east, omitted. ...] blew?. Night of the 18th, last part of the night, the moon was 2 cubits in front of γ Capricorni, the moon being [...]
[Night of the 22nd], last part of the night, the moon [stood] 1 cubit in front of Jupiter to the west [...]
[...] clouds were in the sky, gusty wind. Night of the [2]3rd, very overcast,
lightning flashed, thunder, rain [...] That month, [the equivalent for 1 shekel of silver was:] barley, [...], at the end of the month,
[Night of the 24th, last part of the night,] the moon was 2 cubits below η Piscium [...]
mustard, 1 kur 1 pānu 4 sūtu; cress, [...]
1 kur; dates, [...]
[Jupiter] was in Pisces; Saturn was in Cancer; Venus, Mercury [and Mars, which had set, were not visible ...]

Month III, (the 1st of which was identical with) the 30th (of the preceding month), sunset to moonset: 10° 40'; dense clouds, I did not see the moon. Night [of the ...] was back to the west. Night of the 4th, beginning of the night, the moon was

1 1/2 cubits [behind] α Leonis. The 4th, very overcast, rain DUL, strong gusty wind. Night of the 5th, beginning of the night, the moon was 1? 1/2 cubits [behind ϑ Leonis]. Night of the 6th, beginning of the night, the moon was
1 5/6? cubits behind β Virginis. Night of the 7th, beginning of the night, the moon was [nn mm] behind γ Virginis [...] night, a meteor which was very bright and [had] a tail
[...] flared up [from] north to south?; its light was seen on the ground; it let loose? its flame [...]. Night of the 8th, beginning of the night, the moon was [nn mm] behind α Virginis.

[The 8th, Mercu]ry’s first appearance in the west in Gemini; sunset to setting of Mercury: 14°. Night of the 9th, beginning of the night, the moon was 1 cubit 8 fingers in [front of α Li]brae. Night of the 10th, beginning of the night,
[...] ... Night of the 11th, beginning of the night, the moon was [nn] cubits behind β Scorpii. Night of the 12th, beginning of the night, the moon was [nn mm] in front of ϑ Ophi[uchi].
of τ Capricorni [...]
[... Night] of the 14th, moonrise [to sunset:] 7°. [The 14th, sunrise to moonset: nn°. Ni]ght of the 15th, sunset to moonrise: 5° 30'. Last part of the night, the moon was [nn mm] in front
[...] (ideal) first appearance on the 8th. Night of the 21st, last part of the night, the moon [...]
[...] x cubits. The 17th, Mars’ first appearance in the east in Gemini;
[... Night of the 22nd, last part of the night, the moon was] 3 1/2 cubits [... η Pis]cium. Night
the moon was [nn mm] below α Arietis [...]
[of the 23rd, Night of the 24th,] last part of the night, the moon was 1 1/2 cubits in front of η Tauri.
Night of the 25th, first part of the night, Saturn was below [e Leonis ...]
[Night] of the 27th, last part of the night, the moon was 3 cu[bits] below Mars [...]

[That month, the equi]valent [for 1 shekel of silver was]: barley, 1 kur; dates, 3 pānu? 3 sūtu; mu[stard, ...] (o B24') [... At that] time, Jupiter was in Pisces; Mercury, in the beginning of the month, was in Ca[ncer(sic), ...]
[... Venus, which had set,] was not visible. That month, the river level from the 1st to [...]
[...] receded [nn] fingers, total: the na (gauge) was at [nn].

[Month IV, the 1st (of which followed the 30th of the preceding month); ...] earthshine; the moon was 1/2 cubit in front of α Leonis, 1 cubit in front of Mercury, 2 1/2 cubits behind Saturn. Night [of the 2nd, beginning of the night, the moon was nn mm ... ϑ Leonis. ...]
[... Ni]ght of the 3rd, beginning of the night, the moon was 1/2 cubit behind β Virginis. Night of the 4th, beginning of the night, the moon was [nn mm] below γ Vir[ginis ...]

[Night of the 5th, beginning of the night, the moon was] 1 cubit [... a] Virginis. Night of the 6th, beginning of the night, the moon was 2 cubits in front of α Librae. The 6th, S[aturn’s last appearance (at the end of) Cancer ...]
[Night of the 7th, beginning of the night, the moon was nn] cubits [behind β Librae.] Night of the 8th, beginning of the night, the moon was 1 cubit behind β Scorpii [...]
[Night of the 13th, beginning of the night,] the moon was 1 5/6 cubits behind β Capricorni. The 13th, moonset to sunrise: 1°. Night of the 14[th], moonrise to sunset: [nn°] 30' ... [...]

[Night of the 15th, sunset to moonrise: 11°. Night of the 18th, last part of the night, Jupiter to [...] B6 [...] Night of the 19th, last part of the night, the moon was [nn mm in] front of η Pis[cium ...]
[Ni]ght of the 20th, last part of the night, the moon was 2+[x cubits] below β Arietis [...]
[... Night of the 22nd, last part of the night, the moon was] 3 cubits [...] η Tauri. The 22nd, Mercury’s last appearance [in the wes]t in Leo. [...]

[...] x° rising of [...] to sunrise?. Night of the 23rd, last part of the night, the moon was 1 1/2 cubits behind α Tauri. Night of the 24th, last part of the night, the moon was 1 cubit behind ζ Tauri. Night of the 25th, last part of the night, the mo[on was] 1/2 cubit [... γ Gemi]norum.
Mars was 2 cubits below β Geminorum. Night of the 26th, last part of the night, the moon was 4 1/2 cubits below β Geminorum, 2 1/2 cubits below Mars, Mars having [passed] 4 fingers to [the east].

[The 2]6th, Venus’ first appearance in the west in Leo; sunset to setting of Venus: 9°. The 27th, moonrise to sunrise: 16° 30'. That month, the equivalent (for 1 shekel of silver was): barley, 1 kur; dates, 3 pānu 2 sūtu; mustard,

1 kur 1 pānu 4 sūtu; cress, 5 sât; sesame, 1 pānu 1 sūtu; wool, 2 minas. At that time, Jupiter was in Pisces; Venus, in the beginning of the month, in Cancer, at the end of the month, in Leo; Mars B12 was in Gemini, at the end of the month, in Cancer; Mercury and Saturn, which had set, were not visible. That month, the river level receded 1 cubit 4 fingers; total: [nn] was the na (gauge).

Month V, (the 1st of which was identical with) the 30th (of the preceding month); sunset to moonset: 14°. Night of the 2nd, beginning of the night, the moon was 2 cubits in front of γ Virginis. Night of the 3rd, beginning of the night, the moon was 2 cubits in front of α Virginis. Night of the 5th, beginning of the night,

the moon was 2 cubits below β Librae. Night of the 6th, beginning of the night, the moon was 5/6 cubit in front of β Scorpii. Night of the 7th, be[ginning of the night, the moon] was 1 cubit behind α Scorpii. Night of the 8th, beginning

of the night, the moon was 3 cubits behind ϑ Ophiuchi. Night of the 11th, beginning of the night, the moon was [nn fingers] below ϑ Capricorni [...] it was set to the inside (of the moon). Night of the 12th, beginning of the night,

the moon was 1 2/3 cubits in front of γ Capricorni. The 13th, Saturn’s first appearance in the east in Leo; rising of Saturn to sunrise: 19°; (ideal) first appearance on the [nnth.] The 13th, moonset to sunrise: 12°. Night of the 1[4th],

moonrise to sunset: 4°? 40'. At 27° after sunrise, lunar eclipse, 1/2 (month away from another eclipse), omitted. The 14th, sunrise to moonset: 1° 30'. Night of the 15th, [sunset to moonrise:] 2° 40'?. [The nnth, Mercu]ry’s first appearance in the east in Leo.
[... Night] of the 17th, last part of the night, the moon was in front of [...] Night of the 18th, last part of the night, the moon was 1 cubit behind η Piscium. [...]
wind ... Night of the 19th, last part of the night, the moon was [behind α Arietis ...]
5? fingers. Night of the 21st, ... [...]
the moon was 1 cubit in front of γ Geminorum. [... Night of the 25th, last part of the night, the moon was nn] cu[bits behind δ Cancri,]
1 1/2 cubits in front of Mars. Night of the 27th, last part of the night, the moon was [nn mm] be[hind α Leonis; ... The 27th,] moonrise to sunrise: 24°. The 28th, 25° before sunset,
(possible) solar eclipse; when I watched I did not see it. That month, the equivalent (for 1 shekel of silver was): [...;] cress, 1 pānu 4 sūtu; sesame, ...;

wool, 2 minas. At that time, Jupi[ter was in Pisces; Venus was in Leo, at the end of the month, in Virgo; Mercury was in Leo, at the end of the month, in Can]cer; Saturn was in Leo; Mars was in Cancer. That month,
the river level receded 5/6 cubit, total: 30 [was the na (gauge) ...]

Month VI, (the 1st of which was identical with) the 30th (of the preceding month); sunset to moonset: 12° 30'. The moon was [nn cubits] in front of Venus [...] 8 fingers. Night of the [nnth], beginning of the night, the moon was below [...]
1 1/2 cubits [...] the front star of the head of Scorpius; last part of the night, [...] cubi[t ...]
Night of the 6th, beginning of the night, the moon was [...] behind ϑ Oph[iuchi ...]
Night of the 10th, last part of the night, Mars was below ε Leonis [...]
[Diary from] month I to the end of month VI of year 20, [king] Seleuc[us].
